prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing Thank you - AI for Good Conference greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Create a card saying thank you for attending AI for Good Conference at Stanford, CA June 2025. thank them for helping prosper this conversation. Include her name prominenetly in the front but dont include any people."
Style: âœ¨ Smart Style
Tone: ðŸŒŸ Inspirational - motivating and uplifting
To: Jessica Greenwalt

Message: "Jessica Greenwalt,

Thank you for bringing your voice and vision to the AI for Good Conference. Your presence helped illuminate the path forward, turning a powerful conversation into a beacon of hope for a better, brighter future for all. The seeds of progress we planted together will undoubtedly blossom into meaningful change."



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the motivating and uplifting tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way








Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "Thank you - AI for Good Conference" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a warm, painterly watercolor style featuring a blooming California poppy field at sunrise. The colors are soft and luminous, with washes of golden yellow, soft orange, and blush pink blending seamlessly into a pale cerulean blue sky. The foreground prominently features "Jessica Greenwalt" hand-lettered in an elegant, flowing script that feels both personal and artistic, rendered in a deep indigo ink. The flowers themselves are painted with a delicate, expressive touch, suggesting growth and new beginnings, their petals catching the gentle morning light. The overall composition is peaceful and organic, evoking the natural beauty of the Stanford area and symbolizing the blossoming of new ideas and the dawn of a brighter future, all captured with the heartfelt, handmade quality of a cherished keepsake.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a Thank you - AI for Good Conference card with motivating and uplifting tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a warm, painterly watercolor style featuring a blooming California poppy field at sunrise. The colors are soft and luminous, with washes of golden yellow, soft orange, and blush pink blending seamlessly into a pale cerulean blue sky. The foreground prominently features "Jessica Greenwalt" hand-lettered in an elegant, flowing script that feels both personal and artistic, rendered in a deep indigo ink. The flowers themselves are painted with a delicate, expressive touch, suggesting growth and new beginnings, their petals catching the gentle morning light. The overall composition is peaceful and organic, evoking the natural beauty of the Stanford area and symbolizing the blossoming of new ideas and the dawn of a brighter future, all captured with the heartfelt, handmade quality of a cherished keepsake.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Jessica Greenwalt,

Thank you for bringing your voice and vision to the AI for Good Conference. Your presence helped illuminate the path forward, turning a powerful conversation into a beacon of hope for a better, brighter future for all. The seeds of progress we planted together will undoubtedly blossom into meaningful change." positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Style: in a warm, painterly watercolor style featuring a blooming California poppy field at sunrise. The colors are soft and luminous, with washes of golden yellow, soft orange, and blush pink blending seamlessly into a pale cerulean blue sky. The foreground prominently features "Jessica Greenwalt" hand-lettered in an elegant, flowing script that feels both personal and artistic, rendered in a deep indigo ink. The flowers themselves are painted with a delicate, expressive touch, suggesting growth and new beginnings, their petals catching the gentle morning light. The overall composition is peaceful and organic, evoking the natural beauty of the Stanford area and symbolizing the blossoming of new ideas and the dawn of a brighter future, all captured with the heartfelt, handmade quality of a cherished keepsake.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO TEXT and NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a warm, painterly watercolor style featuring a blooming California poppy field at sunrise. The colors are soft and luminous, with washes of golden yellow, soft orange, and blush pink blending seamlessly into a pale cerulean blue sky. The foreground prominently features "Jessica Greenwalt" hand-lettered in an elegant, flowing script that feels both personal and artistic, rendered in a deep indigo ink. The flowers themselves are painted with a delicate, expressive touch, suggesting growth and new beginnings, their petals catching the gentle morning light. The overall composition is peaceful and organic, evoking the natural beauty of the Stanford area and symbolizing the blossoming of new ideas and the dawn of a brighter future, all captured with the heartfelt, handmade quality of a cherished keepsake.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover: Front cover of a greeting card with a dark navy blue background. At the top center, the text "Thank you" is displayed in white. Below it, on a separate line, "- AI for Good Conference" is also in white. In the lower left quadrant, a stylized, abstract representation of a branching structure with small glowing dots of light appears, primarily in yellow, light blue, and faint green. This structure creatively integrates with and forms the beginning of the name "Jessica". The name "Jessica" is written in a modern, sans-serif font, with "Jessic" in a light blue-green gradient and "a" in white. Below "Jessica", the name "Greenwalt" is written in a larger, similar sans-serif font, with "Greenw" in a light blue-green gradient and "alt" in a soft pink gradient. The overall aesthetic is minimalist, sophisticated, and subtly illuminated, evoking a sense of innovation and connection, with a touch of technological elegance. The composition is clean and modern, with emphasis on the typography and the delicate light-based graphic element. The mood is inspirational and forward-looking.

```json
{
  "frontCover": "Front cover design for a thank you card with a 'Smart Style' aesthetic, in a 9:16 aspect ratio. The artwork should be flat 2D for printing, with full-bleed backgrounds. Suspended in the upper-middle section of the frame, slightly off-center to the right, is a single, glowing orb of warm, golden light, emanating subtle lens flare and soft, rainbow-colored light streaks that fan out gently in a starburst pattern. This orb symbolizes a guiding light or a concentrated point of innovation. The overall mood is serene yet hopeful, with the deep, velvety darkness providing a stark contrast to the luminous central element. The artistic style is minimalist and evocative, focusing on atmospheric depth and the symbolic power of light against darkness. The greeting text \"Thank you - AI for Good Conference\" should be subtly integrated into the dark sky, perhaps as a glowing inscription or in a clean, modern font in a very pale, almost ethereal white or light gold, positioned to avoid the top/bottom 10% edges and 0.5\" from the left/right edges. No people or characters are present.",
  "backCover": "Back cover design for a thank you card with a 'Smart Style' aesthetic, in a 9:16 aspect ratio. The artwork is flat 2D for printing, with full-bleed backgrounds. This gradient suggests the gentle emergence of dawn or the lingering glow from the initial light source. There is no text or any reserved space for QR codes. The design is exceptionally minimalist and serene, providing a peaceful and contemplative conclusion to the visual narrative. These light strands are soft and luminous, with a subtle painterly texture. They create a visual representation of the 'path forward' and the 'conversation blooming'. The background remains a deep, rich indigo, providing a strong contrast for the illuminated elements. The overall composition is ethereal and dynamic, suggesting movement and connection. No text or people are present. The artistic style is sophisticated and abstract, focusing on the interplay of light, color, and form to convey the inspirational tone.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior design for a thank you card with a 'Smart Style' aesthetic, in a 9:16 aspect ratio. The artwork is flat 2D for printing, with full-bleed backgrounds. The 'seeds of progress' are visually represented by a cluster of small, bright, luminous points of light, varying in size and intensity, that appear to be growing and radiating outwards from the center. These points of light are interspersed with delicate, swirling lines of soft, pastel colors â€“ pale gold, rose, and a faint cerulean â€“ which represent the 'blossoming into meaningful change'. These lines and lights are not sharply defined but have a soft, ethereal glow. The message text, \"Jessica Greenwalt,\n\nThank you for bringing your voice and vision to the AI for Good Conference. Your presence helped illuminate the path forward, turning a powerful conversation into a beacon of hope for a better, brighter future for all. The seeds of progress we planted together will undoubtedly blossom into meaningful change.\", should be rendered in a clean, elegant, modern sans-serif font in a soft, glowing white or very pale gold. The text should be positioned centrally, avoiding the top/bottom 10% and 0.5\" from the left/right edges, and should feel integrated into the light and energy of the design, almost as if it's part of the unfolding 'beacon of hope'. No people are present. The artistic style is radiant and uplifting, using light and subtle color gradients to create a powerful and hopeful visual."
```

generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a dark, deep blue background, presented in a 9:16 aspect ratio. The artwork is a stylized, abstract representation of growth and connection, inspired by neural networks or circuit board pathways. A central, upward-reaching structure resembling a tree or branching pathway is depicted, composed of thin, luminous lines in shades of electric blue, golden yellow, and subtle pink and white. These lines emanate from a complex root system at the bottom, spreading outwards and upwards to form branches. Along these branches, small, glowing orbs of light in similar colors act as nodes, some interconnected by the lines, others appearing as solitary points of illumination. A subtle, ethereal quality is achieved through a scattering of tiny, shimmering particles or stardust that permeates the background and trails along the pathways, creating a sense of energy and dynamism. The overall style is modern, sophisticated, and slightly cosmic, evoking a feeling of innovation, progress, and interconnectedness, fitting the "AI for Good" theme. There is no text present on this interior page.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space, featuring a stylized, glowing, tree-like network of branches that originates from the left side and arcs across the top, with vibrant, energetic tendrils in shades of gold, teal, and magenta. The background is a deep, dark navy blue. The text, "Jessica Greenwalt," is prominently displayed in a clean, modern sans-serif font, positioned above the main message body. The thank you message itself is presented in a slightly smaller, yet equally legible sans-serif font, occupying the central portion of the page. The branches frame the text without intruding on the reading space, creating an organic and visually dynamic layout. The overall aesthetic is futuristic and inspirational, with a focus on the luminous quality of the branches against the dark background, evoking a sense of growth, connection, and illumination. The composition is balanced, allowing ample space for personal handwritten notes below the printed message. The style is akin to a digital illustration with a luminous, almost electric quality, emphasizing innovation and forward-thinking. The color palette is rich and contrasting, with the bright, energetic branch colors standing out against the deep, sophisticated background.
